node.excerpt: A  Button  can display either text or an icon. It can be tapped and will run an  onTap  callback when tapped. It may optionally be toggled with each tap. Props Prop Type Notes text string icon string See  Icon  below. type string See  Type  belowâ€¦

A  CheckboxGroup  takes a set of options and turns them into a set of  RowItem s, each of which displays the option together with a  Checkbox . The CheckboxGroupâ€™s value is an array containing all checked options. Props Prop Type Notes options stringâ€¦
Tapping on a  Favorite  will toggle it between on and off. Props Prop Type Notes value boolean onValueChange function Examples

Welcome to the  Learn Design System  docs. In this wiki, youâ€™ll find information on each component included in the Learn Design System, together with information on colors, inputs and patterns of use. Installation Open Framer X Store and  install theâ€¦

An  Icon  displays a Material Design Icon. Props Prop Type Notes icon string A Material Design Icon name. See  Icon  below. color string Any color. size number The size of the icon. Icon The  icon  prop can accept either  â€œnoneâ€  or one of theâ€¦

The Learn Design System supports the  Material Design Systemâ€™s icons . Below youâ€™ll find a list of every valid icon name. You can use these names as the  icon  prop in the  Button ,  Link  and  Icon  components. ...

An  Image  shows an image with an optional color overlay. It may also have a  Favorite . Props Prop Type Notes image string A source URL for the Image's image. overlay boolean color string A color to use for the image's overlay. favorite booleanâ€¦

Value Each of the input components in the Learn package accept a  value  prop. We can use this prop to set the initial value of the input, or to sync its value with another part of our projectâ€™s state. Different input components have values ofâ€¦

A  Link  displays either text or an icon. It can be tapped and will run an  onTap  callback when tapped. Props Prop Type Notes text string icon string The name of the icon to display (see  Icon  below). type string One of the four valid types (seeâ€¦

A  NavigationBar  models the top navigation bar of an iOS app. The bar has a title, an optional subtitle, and two tappable areas on its left and right sides. Each of these areas may have a link, icon or both. The bar has a taller â€œlargeâ€ mode thatâ€¦

Tapping on a  Radio  will turn it on. Radio inputs are normally used as a group in order to capture a mutually-exclusive choice, as is done in the  RadioGroup  component. Props Prop Type Notes value boolean Whether the Radio is checked. disabledâ€¦

A  RadioGroup  takes a set of options and turns them into a set of  RowItem s, each of which displays the option together with a  Radio . The RadioGroupâ€™s value is the currently selected option. Props Prop Type Notes options string[] The groupâ€™sâ€¦

A  RowItem  displays text on the left side and an optional component on the right side: a Checkbox, Radio, Switch or Icon. Props Prop Type Notes text string value boolean The value to pass to the right component. disabled boolean validation functionâ€¦

A  Segment  is a group of options, presented as buttons. Only one option may be selected at once. Props Prop Type Notes value string The selected option. options string [] The Segmentâ€™s options. disabled boolean validation function A callback thatâ€¦
